text: China's phenominal growth is actually amazing, considering it's a non-capitalistic economy. And the prospect of overtaking the US - an out-and-out capitalistic economy - is even more amazing. But the fact that it's an unscrupulous economy, to put it mildly, coupled with the facts that it's too protectionist, has a very expansionist and usurping mentality - makes me feel that its economic success is only ephemeral, and I really doubt it will ever overtake the US. In fact, China had better start preparing for India overtaking it. And yes, don't touch Alibaba with a bargepole - it's on its way to self-destruction.

text: When some people think of successful stock traders, they think of multimillionaires lounging in a beach town, making trades and relaxing. That reality is rare, and stock trading isn't as easy or lucrative as it might seem from the outside. Despite challenges, some people elect to stock trade as a part-time job, or they take on stock trading as their full-time gig. If you know your stuff and follow a strategy, you can make money over time through stock trades by adopting the signal of a licensed broker

author: vivek andhavarapu

text:
That is what I don't understand, It only impacts India or other economies because we follow USA market blindly. See now the Bond interest have increased in USA so it is not the stock market crashing because of these companies going in loss. It is just the same way as the market has reached its peak and there is now more return in bonds. 
Yes in previous crashes the fall in the economy affected India especially the tech stocks. But they don't affect FMCG stocks or other stocks in india that is doing well in the Indian market and is not dependent on the world market
What is so ridiculous is some stocks will benefit from foreign economies crashing but even they fall.
I wonder when will India and especially its financial advisors stop looking at foreign market. I know people who work in Kotak and all they only watch the USA market Then give advice.
It is like these people are responsible for the fall while in reality Indian stock market has no correlation with the USA stock market
Yes if things like war and natural disasters do effect the entire world excluding those things that have a global impact that is first affecting the USA market. Otherwise we should not be even looking at the USA market. I think India will truly rise when we stop aping the USA Market for no reason.
